body:
<!-- Please only use this template for submitting reports about continuously failing tests or jobs in Kubernetes CI -->

**Which jobs are failing**:

sig-windows jobs: https://testgrid.k8s.io/sig-windows#aks-engine-azure-windows-master-staging

**Which test(s) are failing**:

[sig-network] Services should be able to change the type from ClusterIP to ExternalName [Conformance]
[sig-network] Services should be able to change the type from NodePort to ExternalName [Conformance]

**Since when has it been failing**:

It was a false positive until recently.

**Testgrid link**:

https://testgrid.k8s.io/sig-windows#aks-engine-azure-windows-master-staging

**Reason for failure**:

Partially Qualified Domain Names are not currently supported on Windows containers. The tests are checking PQDNs for validation.

The test was passing until recently because ``nslookup`` was still returning the exit code 0, even if the given DNS name was not found:

    [sig-network] Services
      should be able to change the type from NodePort to ExternalName [Conformance]
      /go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/_output/dockerized/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/test/e2e/framework/framework.go:597
    [BeforeEach] [sig-network] Services
      /go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/_output/dockerized/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/test/e2e/framework/framework.go:174
    STEP: Creating a kubernetes client
    Apr 28 21:24:38.587: INFO: >>> kubeConfig: /home/ubuntu/kube/config_200424
    STEP: Building a namespace api object, basename services
    STEP: Binding the e2e-test-privileged-psp PodSecurityPolicy to the default service account in services-2633
    STEP: Waiting for a default service account to be provisioned in namespace
    [BeforeEach] [sig-network] Services
      /go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/_output/dockerized/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/test/e2e/network/service.go:691
    [It] should be able to change the type from NodePort to ExternalName [Conformance]
      /go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/_output/dockerized/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/test/e2e/framework/framework.go:597
    STEP: creating a service nodeport-service with the type=NodePort in namespace services-2633
    STEP: Creating active service to test reachability when its FQDN is referred as externalName for another service
    STEP: creating service externalsvc in namespace services-2633
    STEP: creating replication controller externalsvc in namespace services-2633
    I0428 21:24:42.269902   57864 runners.go:190] Created replication controller with name: externalsvc, namespace: services-2633, replica count: 2
    I0428 21:24:45.471969   57864 runners.go:190] externalsvc Pods: 2 out of 2 created, 0 running, 2 pending, 0 waiting, 0 inactive, 0 terminating, 0 unknown, 0 runningButNotReady
    I0428 21:24:48.472877   57864 runners.go:190] externalsvc Pods: 2 out of 2 created, 0 running, 2 pending, 0 waiting, 0 inactive, 0 terminating, 0 unknown, 0 runningButNotReady
    I0428 21:24:51.473973   57864 runners.go:190] externalsvc Pods: 2 out of 2 created, 1 running, 1 pending, 0 waiting, 0 inactive, 0 terminating, 0 unknown, 0 runningButNotReady
    I0428 21:24:54.474951   57864 runners.go:190] externalsvc Pods: 2 out of 2 created, 2 running, 0 pending, 0 waiting, 0 inactive, 0 terminating, 0 unknown, 0 runningButNotReady
    STEP: changing the NodePort service to type=ExternalName
    Apr 28 21:24:55.544: INFO: Creating new exec pod
    Apr 28 21:25:06.371: INFO: Running '/home/ubuntu/run_e2e/kubernetes/_output/dockerized/bin/linux/amd64/kubectl --server=https://kubetest-63c87972-83ef-11ea-ae60-024273197af3.westus2.cloudapp.azure.com --kubeconfig=/home/ubuntu/kube/config_200424 exec --namespace=services-2633 agnhost-pod -- /bin/sh -x -c nslookup nodeport-service'
    Apr 28 21:25:09.610: INFO: stderr: "+ nslookup nodeport-service\n*** kube-dns.kube-system.svc.cluster.local can't find nodeport-service: Non-existent domain\r\r\n"
    Apr 28 21:25:09.610: INFO: stdout: "Server:  kube-dns.kube-system.svc.cluster.local\r\nAddress:  10.0.0.10\r\n\r\n"
    STEP: deleting ReplicationController externalsvc in namespace services-2633, will wait for the garbage collector to delete the pods
    Apr 28 21:25:10.429: INFO: Deleting ReplicationController externalsvc took: 423.628373ms
    Apr 28 21:25:10.830: INFO: Terminating ReplicationController externalsvc pods took: 400.686463ms
    Apr 28 21:25:15.792: INFO: Cleaning up the NodePort to ExternalName test service
    [AfterEach] [sig-network] Services
      /go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/_output/dockerized/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/test/e2e/framework/framework.go:175
    Apr 28 21:25:16.230: INFO: Waiting up to 3m0s for all (but 0) nodes to be ready
    STEP: Destroying namespace "services-2633" for this suite.
    [AfterEach] [sig-network] Services
      /go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/_output/dockerized/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/test/e2e/network/service.go:695
    â¢{"msg":"PASSED [sig-network] Services should be able to change the type from NodePort to ExternalName [Conformance]","total":2,"completed":2,"skipped":2913,"failed":0}

The issue was observed with an updated ``nslookup``, which doesn't return 0 if the given DNS name was not found.

**Anything else we need to know**:

/sig testing
/sig windows

labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a consistently or frequently failing test.
labels.name: kind/failing-test

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG Testing.

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG Windows.
labels.name: sig/windows

title: ExternalName tests are failing on Windows
